VMAT API documentation¶

hello

Introduction¶

VMAT module .. moduleauthor: James Kerns <jkerns100@gmail.com>

Created on Fri Nov 29 11:35:26 2013

@author: James Kerns <jkerns100@gmail.com>

class pylinac.vmatqa.vmat.VMAT[source]¶

The VMAT class analyzes two DICOM images acquired via a linac’s EPID and analyzes regions of interest based on the paper by Jorgensen et al (http://dx.doi.org/10.1118/1.3552922), specifically, the dose-rate gantry speed (DRGS) and MLC speed (MLCS) tests.

analyze()[source]¶

Analyze 2 VMAT images, the open field and DMLC image, according to 1 of 2 possible tests.

Open and DMLC images must be loaded, tolerance set, and test type chosen

draw_images()[source]¶

Create 2 figures showing the open and dynamic images with the ROIs and results drawn on. For standalone module use. :return:

get_string_results()[source]¶

Create a string return of the summary of the results.

pyqa_textbox: Post string to PyTG142 textbox and change background color to red or green based on results

load_demo_image(test_type='drgs')[source]¶

Load the demo DICOM images from demo files folder

load_image(filepath, im_type='open')[source]¶

Load the image directly by the file path (i.e. non-interactively)

load_image_UI(im_type='open')[source]¶

Open a Qt UI file browser to load dicom image for given VMAT image.

Parameters:im_type – string ‘open’ or ‘dmlc’; specifies which file/image is being loaded
open_Jorgensen_PDF()[source]¶

Open Jorgensen et al in PDF

set_test(test='mlcs')[source]¶

set the test type for the VMAT class

test: ‘drgs’ or 0 for Dose Rate & Gantry Speed test option or
‘mlcs’ or 1 for MLC Speed test option
set_tolerance(tolerance=2.0)[source]¶

set percentage tolerance of the test. Jorgensen suggests a 3% tolerance but this seems too loose based on XP.

tolerance: float; will be converted to percentage.
E.g. setTolerance(2) sets a 2% test tolerance.
